item.description: TheFirebase iOS SDK (v4.6.0)is now available with updates forAnalytics,Authentication,Dynamic Links,Invites, andCloud Firestore. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

item.title: Firebase Realtime Database - Feature
item.description: Firebase Realtime Databasenow supports multiple database instances per project (for projects on theBlaze pricing plan). To learn more about using multiple databases on your project, seeScale with Multiple Databases.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase Admin Node.js SDK (v5.5.0)is now available. This release adds support for multiple database instances per project, for projects on theBlaze pricing plan.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v4.6.2)is now available. It includes bugfixes for issues found in theAuthentication, andCloud Firestorecomponents. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

item.title: Firebaseconsole - Other
item.description: TheFirebaseconsole has been updated with a new visual design. This includes updated navigation with collapsible groups of Firebase products. Products are now grouped into four areas based on the app development lifecycle.

item.title: Firebaseconsole - Other
item.description: The project overview page of theFirebaseconsole has been updated with a new visual design. It now includes current data and last month's trends for each app's daily active users, monthly active users, crash-free user percentage, and total crashes.

item.title: Firebaseconsole - Other
item.description: The Analytics dashboard has been revamped to include new and redesigned cards to support day-to-day questions and tasks. ALatest Releasesection has been added to show adoption and stability of your latest app release.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: Version 5.5.0of the Firebase Admin Java SDK introduces support forCloud Firestore. To install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: Version 2.5.0of the Firebase Admin Python SDK introduces support forCloud Firestore. To install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: Version 2.1.0of the Firebase Admin Go SDK introduces support forCloud Firestore. To install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

This release includes updates toApp Indexing,Analytics,Authentication,Cloud Messaging,Dynamic Links,Cloud Firestore, andPerformance Monitoring. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your Android Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v4.6.1)is now available. It resolves several issues across various components, and includes the newly released Open SourceAuthenticationcodebase. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase iOS SDK (v4.5.0)is now available with updates forAuthentication,Cloud Firestore, andRemote Config. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase Admin Node.js SDK (v5.4.3)is now available. This release fixes a module loading issue in the SDK that prevented its use in environments like AWS Lambda. To install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase SDK for Unity (v4.2.1)is now available with bug fixes forRealtime Database,Cloud Storage, API initialization in .NET 4.x, and improvements to the iOS and Android Resolver components. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your Unity Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v4.6.0)is now available. It contains several bugfixes forAuthentication,Realtime Database, andCloud Firestore, as well as new authenticated user metadata. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase iOS SDK (v4.4.0)is now available with updates forAuthentication,FCM,Cloud Firestore, andRealtime Database. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase Admin Go SDK (v2.0.0)is now available. This release comes with a newCloud StorageAPI and improvements in theAuthenticationAPI. To install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v4.5.1)is now available. It introduces an internal module refactor to better modularize each component. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase Admin Java SDK (v5.4.0)is now available. This release comes with new APIs for processing Google credentials and managing asynchronous tasks. To install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase Admin Node.js SDK (v5.4.2)is now available. This release upgrades the Cloud Firestore client dependency to the latest version available, which fixes an issue related to saving nested document references. To install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

item.title: Cloud Firestore - Feature
item.description: The initial public beta release ofCloud Firestoreis now available for iOS, Android, Web, Java, Python, NodeJS, and Go.Cloud Firestoreis a flexible, scalable database for mobile, web, and server development from Firebase and Google Cloud Platform. LikeRealtime Database, it keeps your data in sync across client apps through realtime listeners and offers offline support so you can build responsive apps that work regardless of network latency or internet connectivity.Cloud Firestorealso offers enterprise-grade scalability and seamless integration with other Firebase and Google Cloud Platform products, includingCloud Functions. For more information aboutCloud Firestore, see theFirebase blog. To get started with Cloud Firestore right away, visit thequickstart.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase iOS SDK (v4.3.0)is now available with support forCloud Firestoreand updates forAnalytics,Authentication,FCM,Performance Monitoring, andRealtime Database. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase Android SDK (v11.4.2)is now available as part of theGoogle Play services 11.4.2 release. This release introduces support forCloud Firestore. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your Android Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase Admin Node.js SDK (v5.4.0)is now available. This release comes with support forCloud Firestore. To install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v4.5.0)is now available. It introduces support forCloud Firestore. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v4.4.0)is now available. It introduces database multi-resource support as well as some fixes to the externs files. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

item.description: Version 1.1.1 of the Firebase Gradle Plugin fixes an issue an issue in 1.1.0 which caused the error "Execution failed for task ':app:packageInstantRunResourcesDebug'" in some cases. To update to the new version, follow the guides forPerformance MonitoringandCrash Reporting.

To install this SDK, seeGet started with Cloud Functions.

item.description: TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v4.1.2)is now available. It includes fixed to various core/build processes. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

item.description: TheFirebase Admin Java SDK (v5.0.1)is now available. It includes a bug fix that makes the SDK more stable when deployed in theApp Engineenvironment. To install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

item.description: TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v4.1.1)is now available. It includes a bugfix for storage default bucket creation. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

item.title: Firebase Performance Monitoring - Feature
item.description: The initial public beta release ofFirebase Performance Monitoringis now available for iOS and Android apps.Performance Monitoringlets you gain insight into your app's performance and network behavior. To learn more about how to usePerformance Monitoringto improve the quality of your app, seeFirebase Performance Monitoring.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other

It includes the beta release ofPerformance Monitoringbreaking changes in all Swift SDKs, and updates toAdMob,Analytics,Authentication,Crash Reporting,Realtime Database,Dynamic Links,Cloud MessagingandRemote Config. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v4.0.0)is now available. This is a major version change that includes breaking changes: please review thedetailed release notesto ensure your app functions as expected. This release includes changes to the overall SDK support, and several changes toAuthenticationincluding the introduction of phone authentication. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase Admin Python SDK (v2.0.0)is now available. This release migrates the SDK to the newgoogle-authlibrary for credential processing and JSON web token (JWT) validation. To install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase Admin Java SDK (v5.0.0)is now available. It includes improvements to the credentials API. To install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase Admin Node.js SDK (v5.0.0)is now available. It includes improvements to the SDK initialization and user managements APIs. To install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

item.title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
item.description: Firebaseconsole now supports multiple logged-in users. Users can toggle accounts through the account switcher in the top navigation bar.

item.title: Crash Reporting - Feature
item.description: Added the ability to see the percentage of users who have not encountered an error (crash or non-fatal error) in an app over the selected timeframe to theFirebaseconsole. This is shown in theError-free users panelof theCrash Reportingconsole.

item.title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
item.description: Shorthand names for apps, known as "app nicknames" are now managed from and visible throughout theFirebaseconsole.

item.title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
item.description: Simplified the process of adding service accounts to a project.

item.title: Analytics - Changed
item.description: Increased the maximum length of event names and parameter names to 40 characters, and the maximum length of string parameter values to 100 characters.

item.title: the Notifications composer - Feature
item.description: Instance ID keys are now available in the Notifications settings area of theFirebaseconsole.

item.title: Google Analytics - Fixed
item.description: Existing users who update to anAnalytics-enabled version of an app are no longer included infirst_openmetrics. This server-side correction could cause a drop infirst_openmetrics.

item.title: Crash Reporting - Changed
item.description: Firebase Crash Reportinghas now exited beta. To get started usingCrash Reporting, see theCrash Reportingintroduction.

item.title: Firebase Test Lab - Feature
item.description: You can now run several tests per day on both the Spark (free) and Flame pricing plans. To learn more, seeFirebase Pricing.

item.title: Remote Config - Feature
item.description: Added the ability to randomly re-assign app users to new percentage ranges inUser in random percentilerules. To learn more, seeRemote Config Rule types.

item.title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
item.description: Project owners and editors can now create app "nicknames" that are displayed throughout theFirebaseconsole alongside the full package name or bundle ID.

item.title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
item.description: Project owners and editors can now change the reporting currency for their apps.

item.title: Authentication - Feature
item.description: Removed the 500 user limit on the Users Table in theFirebaseconsole, and improved search within this table.

item.title: Dynamic Links - Feature
item.description: You can generate shortDynamic Linksprogrammatically using theLink Shortener REST API.

item.title: Dynamic Links - Feature
item.description: You can now enable Android AppLinks by entering a SHA256 checksum in theFirebaseconsole.

item.title: Remote Config - Feature
item.description: Added support for usingGoogle Analyticsuser properties to create conditions. To learn more, seeRemote Config and user properties.

item.title: Test Lab - Changed
item.description: Test Labwill now charge $1 per device hour to test apps on Android Virtual Devices (AVDs). To learn more about how billing is calculated for Test Lab, seeTest Lab billing.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v3.4.1)is now available. It includes updates toRealtime DatabaseandCloud Storage. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase Android SDK (v9.6)is now available as part of theGoogle Play services 9.6 release. It includes updates toAnalytics,Cloud Messaging,Authentication,Realtime Database, andDynamic Links. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your Android Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebaseC++SDK (v1.2.0)is now available. It includes updates toCloud Messaging,Authentication,Remote Config,InvitesandAdMob. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your C++ Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase iOS SDK (v3.6.0)is now available. It includes updates toAnalytics,Cloud Messaging,Authentication,Realtime Database,Remote Config,Dynamic LinksandAdMob. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v3.4.0)is now available. It includes updates toRealtime Database. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

item.title: Dynamic Links - Feature
item.description: You can debug the behavior of longDynamic Linksacross platforms by adding the following to the end of anyDynamic LinkURL:&d=1.

item.title: Dynamic Links - Changed
item.description: When a user clicks aDynamic Linkto an app that is not installed on their iOS device, thatDynamic Linkwill now open the installation page for that app in the App Store, unless an iOS fallback link parameter is specified. This is true whether the user clicked the link in Safari, or in another app.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase iOS SDK (v3.5.2)is now available. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase iOS SDK (v3.5.1)is now available. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

item.title: Remote Config - Feature
item.description: Added the ability to search parameters and conditions from theRemote ConfigParameterstab in theFirebaseconsole.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase iOS SDK (v3.4.0)is now available. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebase Android SDK (v9.4)is now available as part of theGoogle Play services 9.4 release. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your Android Project.

item.title: SDK Releases - Other
item.description: TheFirebaseC++SDK (v1.1.0)is now available. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your C++ Project.

item.title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
item.description: AView Onlyindicator is now displayed at the top of theFirebaseconsole for projects that you have read-only access to. A number of action buttons have also been updated to be hidden or disabled for users who do not haveEditororOwnerpermissions for a project.

item.title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
item.description: You can delete apps from projects using a new action button in the Advanced Options section when managing an app.

item.title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
item.description: You can edit the name of a project after creating it in theProject Settingsdialog.

item.title: Realtime Database - Feature
item.description: You can now view usage metrics in theFirebaseconsole by clicking on theUsagetab. Firebase currently tracks bandwidth usage, total storage used, and the maximum number of concurrent connections.

item.title: Hosting - Feature
item.description: You can now view usage metrics forHostingin theFirebaseconsole by clicking on theUsagetab. Firebase currently tracks bytes sent (bandwidth) and total storage used.

item.title: the Notifications composer - Feature
item.description: Added pagination to the Notifications summary view, to make scrolling and viewing of many notification messages easier.

item.title: Firebase Test Lab - Feature
item.description: Test Labnow includes virtual devices. To learn more, seeTest Your App with Android Virtual Devices.

item.title: Documentation - Fixed
item.description: In response to customer feedback, we've made hundreds of small improvements to theFirebase documentation.

item.title: the Notifications composer - Feature
item.description: You can now add more than three custom data fields when sending a notification. A notification should not exceed 4KB total, including message text, custom data, and any advanced options.

item.title: the Notifications composer - Feature
item.description: Reduced the refresh interval for app versions and language lists.

item.title: the Notifications composer - Feature
item.description: The conversion event counts in the the Notifications composerGoogle Analyticsfunnel view now show the number of users who have triggered the conversion event at least once. Previously, it showed the raw number of triggered conversion events.

item.title: C++ SDK - Other
item.description: TheFirebaseC++SDK (v1.0.1)is now available. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your C++ Project.

item.title: Authentication - Fixed
item.description: The Google Play services version 9.0.2 release is now available. This release fixes aknown issuewithFirebase Authenticationwhere theFirebaseAuthApiis not available on some devices. AFirebaseApiNotAvailableExceptionerror occurs when those devices attempt to use Authentication APIs.

item.title: Crash Reporting - Fixed
item.description: Updated the Firebase Crash Reporting iOS SDK to fix issues with the symbol upload script used by Crash Reporting, and also to fix other miscellaneous issues with this SDK.

item.title: Realtime Database - Changed
item.description: The way you install and initialize the SDK has changed and several APIs have been renamed. When you decide to upgrade, please see theWeb Migration Guide,iOS Migration Guide, orAndroid Migration Guidefor details.

item.title: Realtime Database - Changed
item.description: The way you install and initialize the Node.js and Java server SDKs has also changed. APIs have been renamed and you now authenticate using aservice accountinstead of a secret or custom token. When you choose to upgrade, please see theDatabase Server SDK Setup Guideand use theWeb Migration GuideorAndroid Migration Guideto help you update your Node.js or Java code to the latest APIs.

item.title: Authentication - Changed
item.description: The way you install and initialize the SDK has changed and most APIs have been renamed. When you decide to upgrade, please see theiOS Migration Guide,Web Migration Guide, orAndroid Migration Guidefor details.

item.title: Authentication - Changed
item.description: Node.js / Java server SDKs:Token minting and verificationforFirebase Authenticationis now built into the server SDKs themselves instead of in separate token minting libraries.All of the existing authentication methods have been removed. Instead, use thedatabaseAuthVariableOverrideoption (Node.js) orsetDatabaseAuthVariableOverride()method (Java) when initializing the SDK. Seeherefor more details.Use theWeb Migration GuideorAndroid Migration Guideto help you update your Node.js or Java code to the latest APIs.

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: Token minting and verificationforFirebase Authenticationis now built into the server SDKs themselves instead of in separate token minting libraries.All of the existing authentication methods have been removed. Instead, use thedatabaseAuthVariableOverrideoption (Node.js) orsetDatabaseAuthVariableOverride()method (Java) when initializing the SDK. Seeherefor more details.Use theWeb Migration GuideorAndroid Migration Guideto help you update your Node.js or Java code to the latest APIs.

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: All of the existing authentication methods have been removed. Instead, use thedatabaseAuthVariableOverrideoption (Node.js) orsetDatabaseAuthVariableOverride()method (Java) when initializing the SDK. Seeherefor more details.

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: Use theWeb Migration GuideorAndroid Migration Guideto help you update your Node.js or Java code to the latest APIs.

item.title: Authentication - Issue
item.description: General:Limited profile data extracted from federated providers (e.g. doesn’t include the Twitter username).Workaroundwhere possible, extract this information from the 3rd party SDKs.

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: Limited profile data extracted from federated providers (e.g. doesn’t include the Twitter username).

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: Workaroundwhere possible, extract this information from the 3rd party SDKs.

item.title: Authentication - Issue
item.description: Firebase Android SDK:FirebaseUser#linkWithCredential()may invalidate a user's credentials.Description: After callinglinkWithCredential()with a credential that is not anEmailAuthCredential, sometimes consecutive calls on the user object may throw an Exception:FirebaseException (An internal error has occurred. [ TOKEN_EXPIRED ]).WorkaroundCache the credential used on a linking event, and if this error is thrown, sign the user out after the linking and callFirebaseAuth#signInWithCredential()with the cached credential afterwards.Missing API to start email verification flow.Some Network exceptions are thrown asFirebaseExceptionrather thanFirebaseNetworkException.

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: FirebaseUser#linkWithCredential()may invalidate a user's credentials.Description: After callinglinkWithCredential()with a credential that is not anEmailAuthCredential, sometimes consecutive calls on the user object may throw an Exception:FirebaseException (An internal error has occurred. [ TOKEN_EXPIRED ]).WorkaroundCache the credential used on a linking event, and if this error is thrown, sign the user out after the linking and callFirebaseAuth#signInWithCredential()with the cached credential afterwards.

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: Description: After callinglinkWithCredential()with a credential that is not anEmailAuthCredential, sometimes consecutive calls on the user object may throw an Exception:FirebaseException (An internal error has occurred. [ TOKEN_EXPIRED ]).

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: WorkaroundCache the credential used on a linking event, and if this error is thrown, sign the user out after the linking and callFirebaseAuth#signInWithCredential()with the cached credential afterwards.

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: Missing API to start email verification flow.

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: Some Network exceptions are thrown asFirebaseExceptionrather thanFirebaseNetworkException.

item.title: Authentication - Issue
item.description: FirebaseSDK forAppleplatforms:sendPasswordResetWithEmail:completion:does not call the completion handler in the main thread as claimed.Workaround:Objective-C[[FIRAuthauth]sendPasswordResetWithEmail:@"user@host.domain"completion:^(NSError*_Nullableerror){dispatch_async(dispatch_get_main_queue(),^{// original completion handler code.});}];SwiftFIRAuth.auth()?.sendPasswordResetWithEmail("user@host.domain"){errorindispatch_async(dispatch_get_main_queue()){//originalcompletionhandlercode.}}API reference docs do not contain information about error conditions: see themhere.Authentication state is shared between different apps when running on. the iOS Simulator:Description: when running two or more applications that useFirebase Authenticationon the same iOS simulator, there is a issue with the iOS keychain that causes the authentication state to be shared across the different applications. This means that if you sign in to an app, and later open a second app, you may find a user to be signed in into it.Workaround: either don't use two different applications withAuthenticationon the same simulator instance, or manually sign out from the applications between tests.FirebaseJavaScriptSDK:If you change the authdomain configuration of an app while some users are signed in, you have to sign them out and in again in order to use linkWithPopup/Redirect APIsDoes not work in Safari private browsing mode.

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: sendPasswordResetWithEmail:completion:does not call the completion handler in the main thread as claimed.Workaround:Objective-C[[FIRAuthauth]sendPasswordResetWithEmail:@"user@host.domain"completion:^(NSError*_Nullableerror){dispatch_async(dispatch_get_main_queue(),^{// original completion handler code.});}];SwiftFIRAuth.auth()?.sendPasswordResetWithEmail("user@host.domain"){errorindispatch_async(dispatch_get_main_queue()){//originalcompletionhandlercode.}}API reference docs do not contain information about error conditions: see themhere.Authentication state is shared between different apps when running on. the iOS Simulator:Description: when running two or more applications that useFirebase Authenticationon the same iOS simulator, there is a issue with the iOS keychain that causes the authentication state to be shared across the different applications. This means that if you sign in to an app, and later open a second app, you may find a user to be signed in into it.Workaround: either don't use two different applications withAuthenticationon the same simulator instance, or manually sign out from the applications between tests.

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: Workaround:Objective-C[[FIRAuthauth]sendPasswordResetWithEmail:@"user@host.domain"completion:^(NSError*_Nullableerror){dispatch_async(dispatch_get_main_queue(),^{// original completion handler code.});}];SwiftFIRAuth.auth()?.sendPasswordResetWithEmail("user@host.domain"){errorindispatch_async(dispatch_get_main_queue()){//originalcompletionhandlercode.}}

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: API reference docs do not contain information about error conditions: see themhere.

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: Authentication state is shared between different apps when running on. the iOS Simulator:Description: when running two or more applications that useFirebase Authenticationon the same iOS simulator, there is a issue with the iOS keychain that causes the authentication state to be shared across the different applications. This means that if you sign in to an app, and later open a second app, you may find a user to be signed in into it.Workaround: either don't use two different applications withAuthenticationon the same simulator instance, or manually sign out from the applications between tests.

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: Description: when running two or more applications that useFirebase Authenticationon the same iOS simulator, there is a issue with the iOS keychain that causes the authentication state to be shared across the different applications. This means that if you sign in to an app, and later open a second app, you may find a user to be signed in into it.

item.title: Authentication - Other
item.description: Workaround: either don't use two different applications withAuthenticationon the same simulator instance, or manually sign out from the applications between tests.

item.title: Authentication - Issue
item.description: FirebaseJavaScriptSDK:If you change the authdomain configuration of an app while some users are signed in, you have to sign them out and in again in order to use linkWithPopup/Redirect APIsDoes not work in Safari private browsing mode.

item.title: Cloud Storage - Feature
item.description: Initial release ofCloud Storage.Cloud Storageprovides secure file uploads and downloads for your Firebase apps, regardless of network quality. You can use it to store images, audio, video, or other user-generated content. Firebase Storage is backed byGoogle Cloud Storage, a powerful, simple, and cost-effective object storage service.

item.title: Cloud Storage - Issue
item.description: Firebaseconsole: Only project owners can updateFirebase Security RulesforCloud Storage, and only owners and editors can viewCloud StorageSecurity Rules.

item.title: FCM - Feature
item.description: Initial release ofCloud Messaging.

item.title: FCM - Issue
item.description: FirebaseC++SDK:Messages with both a notification and data payload are not delivered to an Android application open in the background.Description:On Android, when the app is open in the background and it receives a message with both a notification and data payload, the message is not delivered to the application.Workaround:In the application's activity, (e.g.NativeActivity), override theonNewIntent(Intent intent)method and pass theintentargument through to the methodsetIntent(Intent intent)For example:publicclassMyActivityextendsNativeActivity{@OverrideonNewIntent(Intentintent){setIntent(intent);}}Seethe quickstart samplefor an example of this workaround in action.

item.title: FCM - Other
item.description: Messages with both a notification and data payload are not delivered to an Android application open in the background.

item.title: FCM - Other
item.description: Description:On Android, when the app is open in the background and it receives a message with both a notification and data payload, the message is not delivered to the application.

item.title: FCM - Other
item.description: Workaround:In the application's activity, (e.g.NativeActivity), override theonNewIntent(Intent intent)method and pass theintentargument through to the methodsetIntent(Intent intent)For example:publicclassMyActivityextendsNativeActivity{@OverrideonNewIntent(Intentintent){setIntent(intent);}}Seethe quickstart samplefor an example of this workaround in action.

item.title: FCM - Other
item.description: For example:publicclassMyActivityextendsNativeActivity{@OverrideonNewIntent(Intentintent){setIntent(intent);}}Seethe quickstart samplefor an example of this workaround in action.
